As these brethren go to the South to take hold of pioneer work in a difficult field, we ask our people to make their work as effective as possible by assisting them in the establishment of the new school near Nashville. . . . Brethren and sisters, the poverty and the needs of the Southern field call urgently for 
                                                                           75
your assistance. There is a great work to be done in that field, and we ask you to act your part. [REVIEW AND HERALD, AUG. 18 1904.]
